$MSFT $QQQget ready for the a positive spin to be put on the CPI numbers to fool retail investors into buying. I think the narrative will be to blame the Ukraine War for all of the inflation 😏

$AAPL i read the fed balance sheet. The “other” assets on there is $410 Billion. Now all of it cant be US equities. Lets say, 60% of it is US equities. $246 billion US equities. So thats about 5% of the total holdings. Which is less than 2% of the GDP. Why is this such a big deal again? Most of that stock can be bought back by companies themselves in case of businesses like $aapl $msft and heck even $fb. Anyone with a more precise number, feel free to educate me i am genuinely asking, how much US equity is on their balance sheet?

Either way, relief rally or not, I’m bearish in the short to medium term and will continue holding my puts in anticipation of a major market crash. $QQQ
